subject: Self Care
title: The PERMA Model
description: A short lesson to help you apply The PERMA Model.

hook.text: Seligman distilled well-being into five letters: PERMA. It stands for the five pillars that make a life genuinely flourishing.

buildup.text: PERMA: Positive emotions, Engagement, Relationships, Meaning, and Accomplishment. Each pillar is pursued for its own sake.

discovery.text: Well-being isn't just feeling good. It includes doing good, connecting deeply, finding meaning, and achieving goals that matter.

twist.text: Most people over-invest in one pillar and neglect others. True flourishing requires all five to be reasonably nourished.

climax.text: Rate yourself one to ten on each PERMA element. The lowest score shows where to invest next. Balance is the strategy.

punchline.text: PERMA: five pillars of flourishing. Find your weakest. Invest there first.

quiz.question: What does PERMA stand for?
options: Positive emotions, Engagement, Relationships, Meaning, Accomplishment
